caption: BATTLEFRONT BREATHER Troops in a village retaken in Ukraine’s counteroffensive. Every step forward brings more danger. Page A8.
image_1.context: The physical destruction of the village watering hole in Velyka Komyshuvakha was only part of what the Russians left behind. In the bar’s back room was a twisted blueprint of the minds of some of the rank and  UKRAINE that Russian forces DISPATCH had occupied a village in eastern Ukraine, the troops had used the local bar as a small outpost, gutting it in the process. By THOMAS GIBBONS-NEFF VELYKA KOMYSHUVAKHA, Ukraine — Sweeping out the discarded Russian rations, shat tered glass and broken furniture was a daunting task. In the four and a half months Crude Scrawls Reveal Minds NEW YORK, FRIDAY, JUNE 16, 2023
image_1.description: The image depicts a scene of destruction and desolation in a village that has been retaken during Ukraine’s counteroffensive. The setting is an abandoned building with a partially collapsed roof, exposing the sky through the damaged structure. The walls are made of brick and have large windows, some of which are broken or missing. The ground is littered with debris, including twisted metal sheets and other rubble. Three soldiers are present in the scene. One soldier is sitting on a large tire, smoking a cigarette, while another is kneeling nearby, possibly using a mobile device. The third soldier is seated on a piece of machinery or equipment, also appearing to be resting or taking a break. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of tension and fatigue, as the soldiers take a momentary respite amidst the ruins. The background includes a fence made of corrugated metal sheets, some of which are bent and damaged, adding to the sense of destruction. The soldiers are dressed in camouflage uniforms, indicating their military role in the ongoing conflict.

image_2.context: When Donald J. Trump responded to his latest indictment by promising to appoint a special prosecutor if he’s re-elected to “go after” President Biden and his family, he signaled that a second Trump term would fully jettison the post-Watergate norm of Justice Department independence. This article is by Jonathan Swan, Charlie Savage and Maggie Haberman. UPHOLDS SOVEREIGNTY SUPREME COURT RULES FOR TRIBES ON ADOPTION LAW Legal Rationale to End Its Independence Trump Allies Plan to Stifle Justice Dept. Putting the Gloves On At the New York Botanical Garden, works by the artist Ebony G. Patterson are on display. Page C10. One former White House officialwbowas grantedane ymity while the materials were disorganized, Mr. Trump would notice if somebody had riffled through them or they were not arranged in a particular way. It was, the person said, how “his mind worked.” The contents of those boxes — and Mr. Trump’s insistence on hanging onto them — are now at the heart of a 38-count indictment against the former president and his personal aide, Walt Nauta. Prosecutors have accused Mr. Trump of obstructing their investigation into his possession of classified material after leaving office and putting national security seContinued on Page A14
image_2.description: The image depicts a striking art installation located in a grand, white-walled room with a large, circular skylight at the top. The installation consists of a dense aggregation of red, glove-like objects that appear to be made of a soft material, possibly fabric or rubber. These gloves are densely packed and form a mound that fills the lower half of the image. Interspersed among the gloves are black, thorny branches that add a contrasting texture and color to the scene. The overall atmosphere is one of intensity and perhaps unease, given the unusual combination of elements and the overwhelming presence of the gloves. The stark white walls and ceiling provide a dramatic backdrop that highlights the vivid red of the gloves and the dark, spiky branches.

image_3.context: The majority dismissed the equal protection argument, saying that no party in the case had Continued on Page The tribes have said that they are political entities, not racial groups. Doing away with that distinction, which underpins tribal rights, they argued, could imperil nearly every aspect of Indian law and policy, including measures that govern access to land, water and gambling. Under the act, preference is given to Native families, a policy that the couple said violated equal protection principles because it hinges on placement based on race. ment as they battled over the adoption of a Native American child.  the basic principles that have allowed them to govern themselves for years. Justice Amy Coney Barrett, writing for the majority, affirmed the power of Congress to make laws about Native American tribes and child welfare. But the ruling did not resolve the question of whether the law, the Indian Child Welfare Act, discriminated against non-Native families based on race. The vote was 7 to 2, with Justices Clarence Thomas and Samuel A. Alito Jr. dissenting. The case pitted a white foster couple from Texas against five tribes and the Interior DepartBackers of the Native Americans’ case. The ruling was 7-2.
image_3.description: The image depicts two women standing in front of a building that appears to be the Supreme Court, based on its architectural style. Both women are holding signs with the text 'STOP STEALING NATIVE KIDS' and 'PROTECT ICWA'. The woman on the left has long hair and is wearing a dark jacket over a purple scarf. She is holding her sign with both hands. The woman on the right has long hair as well, is wearing sunglasses, and is dressed in a pink top. She is holding her sign with one hand. The background shows the columns and facade of the Supreme Court building, indicating that this is likely a protest or demonstration related to Native American child welfare issues.

PAGE B1 Rates Head Higher in Europe The central bank, signaling it wasn’t done, projected that inflation would remain too high for too long. PAGE B “It’s just this drive to eat,” said Ms. Isotalo, a retired interior design coordinator. “It’s almost like this panic feeling when you start craving food.”  “My mental shame was profound,” she said. Now, though, since she started taking Wegovy, one of a new class of drugs for obesity that was prescribed by her doctor at the clinic, those cravings are gone. She has lost 50 pounds and jettisoned the dark clothes she wore to hide her body. Her obesity-related medical problems have vanished along with much of the stigma that caused her to retreat from family Continued on Page A19
image_4.description: The image depicts an indoor scene of a shopping mall with a modern and sleek design. The floor is tiled with a pattern of black and white squares, creating a striking contrast. On the left side of the image, there is a sign that reads 'NORDSTROM' in capital letters, indicating the presence of the Nordstrom store. A person is seen walking towards the Nordstrom entrance, which is illuminated by warm lighting, creating a welcoming atmosphere. The right side of the image shows a closed-off area with a metallic rolling shutter door, suggesting it might be a closed or under-construction section of the mall. The ceiling features recessed lighting and a geometric design, adding to the contemporary feel of the space. The overall atmosphere is clean, well-lit, and organized, typical of a high-end shopping mall.

image_5.context: Actor Turned Politician A two-time Oscar winner, Glenda Jackson left acting to enter the British Parliament. Decades later, she returned to Broadway. She was 87. image_5.description: The image depicts a golf course scene, specifically a hole on a golf course. The foreground shows a sandy area with sparse grass, leading up to a well-maintained green. To the right of the green is a sand bunker, and there is another bunker located further back on the left side of the fairway. The fairway itself is bordered by tall grass and shrubs, creating a natural boundary. In the background, there are trees and a sign indicating the hole number, which is '4'. The overall atmosphere is serene and picturesque, typical of a golf course setting.

image_6.description: The image features a person with short, light brown hair styled in a bob cut. The individual is wearing a patterned garment with a mix of colors and designs, including geometric shapes and possibly floral elements. The background includes a large, colorful mural or painting that depicts a stylized face with prominent eyes and a serene expression. The mural has a blend of earthy tones and vibrant colors, creating a warm and artistic atmosphere. The person appears to be seated or standing in front of the mural, contributing to a relaxed and contemplative mood.
